visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing the proportional composition of egg yolk components using interactive slices with percentage annotations and categorical color coding
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains five categorical variables representing biochemical components of egg yolk, measured as percentages summing to 100%. While sourced from peer-reviewed nutritional research, the values demonstrate domain-appropriate precision (two decimal places) and biological plausibility through macronutrient dominance (water > fat > protein). The pie chart visualization maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines and axes while maintaining Cairo's principle of proportional perception through radial area encoding. Color saturation gradients (dark blue to light blue) create visual hierarchy without introducing false ordinal relationships. Interactive slicing maintains Tufte's principle of detail-on-demand while preserving the whole-to-part relationship in default view. Statistical validity is maintained through exact proportional representation (Σ=100%) rather than synthetic generation.
